nodes.bodyText: This is always true because you've set the required attribute on these elements. Please replace these assertions with something that tests if the field is invalid (i.e. by checking the state of component.form)

nodes.bodyText: Why are we using Reactive forms in #916 and not here. For two components that are basically the same they should be implemented the same way.

You aren't telling the user what your criteria is. Also password should be lowercase

nodes.bodyText: This is a bug. hasOwnProperty will never return null. These linter rules are in here for a reason.
Don't disable this rule. Fix it properly.

nodes.bodyText: What is 43? Don't use magic numbers (https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-magic-numbers), use a named constant instead.
nit: options. It's clear what this is being used for.
Is this ever going to change? Can't it be a constant in the auth service?

nodes.bodyText: Don't chain ternaries, just use an if/return

return {validPassword: true}
You don't need an intermediate variable.
Instead of chaining subscribes it's better to use pipe(switchMap(...))
Someone's name could be more than 15 characters. Please remove.

nodes.bodyText: This initial value is never used
Why expose this here? Clients should get this from the auth service since it's the source of truth.
